refnamediv.refpurpose: Lightweight objects to signal the application of pipeline events.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Messages are implemented as a subclass of gst.MiniObject with a generic gst.Structure as the content. This allows for writing custom messages without requiring an API change while allowing a wide range of different types of messages.
Messages are posted by objects in the pipeline and are passed to the application using the gst.Bus.
A gst.Element usually posts messages on the bus provided by the parent container using gst.Element.post_message()

refsect2.title: gst.Message.parse_clock_lost
refsect2.para: The parse_clock_lost() method extracts the lost clock from the GstMessage. The clock object returned remains valid until the message is freed.

refsect2.title: gst.Message.parse_clock_provide
refsect2.para: The parse_clock_provide() method extracts the clock and ready flag from the GstMessage. The clock object returned remains valid until the message is freed.

refsect2.title: gst.Message.parse_duration
refsect2.para: The parse_duration() method extracts the duration and format from the duration message. The duration might be gst.CLOCK_TIME_NONE, which indicates that the duration has changed. Applications should always use a query to retrieve the duration of a pipeline.

refsect2.title: gst.Message.parse_error
refsect2.para: The parse_error() method extracts the gerror and debug string from the gst.Message. The values returned in the output arguments are copies.

refsect2.title: gst.Message.parse_new_clock
refsect2.para: The parse_new_clock() method extracts the new clock from the GstMessage. The clock object returned remains valid until the message is freed.

refsect2.title: gst.Message.parse_segment_done
refsect2.para: The parse_segment_done() method extracts the position and format from the segment start message.

refsect2.title: gst.Message.parse_segment_start
refsect2.para: The parse_segment_start() method extracts the position and format from the segment start message.

refsect2.title: gst.Message.parse_state_changed
refsect2.para: The parse_state_changed() method extracts the old and new states from the gst.Message.

refsect2.title: gst.Message.parse_tag
refsect2.para: The parse_tag() method extracts the tag list from the gst.Message. The tag list returned in the output argument is a copy.

refsect2.title: gst.Message.parse_warning
refsect2.para: The parse_warning() method extracts the gerror and debug string from the gst.Message. The values returned in the output arguments are copies.

refsect2.title: gst.message_new_application

listitem.simpara: The structure for the message. The message will take ownership of the structure..

refsect2.para: The message_new_application() function creates a new application-typed message. GStreamer will never create these messages; they are a gift from us to you. Enjoy.

refsect2.title: gst.message_new_clock_lost
refsect2.para: The message_new_clock_lost() function creates a clock lost message. This message is posted whenever the clock is not valid anymore.
If this message is posted by the pipeline, the pipeline will select a new clock again when it goes to PLAYING. It might therefore be needed to set the pipeline to PAUSED and PLAYING again.

refsect2.title: gst.message_new_clock_provide

listitem.simpara: True if the sender can provide a clock.

refsect2.para: The message_new_clock_provide() function creates a clock provide message. This message is posted whenever an element is ready to provide a clock or lost its ability to provide a clock (maybe because it paused or became EOS).
This message is mainly used internally to manage the clock selection.

refsect2.title: gst.message_new_custom

listitem.simpara: The structure for the message. The message will take ownership of the structure..

refsect2.para: The message_new_custom() function create a new custom-typed message. This can be used for anything not handled by other message-specific functions to pass a message to the app. The structure field can be None.

refsect2.title: gst.message_new_duration
refsect2.para: The message_new_duration() function creates a new duration message. This message is posted by elements that know the duration of a stream in a specific format. This message is received by bins and is used to calculate the total duration of a pipeline. Elements may post a duration message with a duration of gst.CLOCK_TIME_NONE to indicate that the duration has changed and the cached duration should be discarded. The new duration can then be retrieved via a query.

refsect2.title: gst.message_new_element

listitem.simpara: The structure for the message. The message will take ownership of the structure..

refsect2.para: The message_new_element() function creates a new element-specific message. This is meant as a generic way of allowing one-way communication from an element to an application, for example "the firewire cable was unplugged". The format of the message should be documented in the element's documentation. The structure field can be None.

refsect2.title: gst.message_new_eos
refsect2.para: The message_new_eos() function creates a new eos message. This message is generated and posted in the sink elements of a gst.Bin. The bin will only forward the EOS message to the application if all sinks have posted an EOS message.

refsect2.title: gst.message_new_error

listitem.simpara: A debugging string for something or other.

refsect2.para: The message_new_error() function creates a new error message. The message will copy error and debug. This message is posted by element when a fatal event occured. The pipeline will probably (partially) stop.

refsect2.title: gst.message_new_new_clock
refsect2.para: The message_new_new_clock() function creates a new clock message. This message is posted whenever the pipeline selectes a new clock for the pipeline.

refsect2.title: gst.message_new_segment_done

listitem.simpara: The format of the position being done.
The position of the segment being done.

refsect2.para: The message_new_segment_done() function creates a new segment done message. This message is posted by elements that finish playback of a segment as a result of a segment seek. This message is received by the application after all elements that posted a segment_start have posted the segment_done.

refsect2.title: gst.message_new_segment_start

listitem.simpara: The format of the position being played.
The position of the segment being played.

refsect2.para: The message_new_segment_start() function creates a new segment message. This message is posted by elements that start playback of a segment as a result of a segment seek. This message is not received by the application but is used for maintenance reasons in container elements.

refsect2.title: gst.message_new_state_changed
refsect2.para: The message_new_state_changed() function creates a state change message. This message is posted whenever an element changed its state.

refsect2.title: gst.message_new_state_dirty
refsect2.para: The message_new_state_dirty() function creates a state dirty message. This message is posted whenever an element changed its state asynchronously and is used internally to update the states of container objects.

refsect2.title: gst.message_new_tag

listitem.simpara: The tag list for the message.

refsect2.para: The message_new_tag() function creates a new tag message. The message will take ownership of the tag list. The message is posted by elements that discovered a new taglist.

refsect2.title: gst.message_new_warning

listitem.simpara: A debugging string for something or other.

refsect2.para: The message_new_warning() function creates a new warning message. The message will make copies of error and debug.
